name: Ability Score Improvement
mechanic: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. You may instead take a Feat.
class-list: Adept, Engineer, Infiltrator, Sentinel, Soldier, Vanguard

name: Action Surge
mechanic: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

name: Adrenaline Rush
mechanic: Inject an adrenaline serum to accelerate your reflexes. On your turn, you can activate Adrenaline Rush as a bonus action. When you activate Adrenaline Rush, choose an available combat feature, tech, or spell, then roll an Adrenaline Dice (AD). Features explain how the die roll affects the ability. For tech, your die roll is the Tech Point (TP) cost. For spells, the roll represents the level at which you cast the spell. If you try to cast a level 4 spell, but roll a 3, subtract 1 damage dice from the damage role. You can still take your normal action this turn. -- You regain 1 AD on a short rest, and all your AD on a long rest.

name: Advanced Targeting
mechanic: You can move slowly while Targeting giving you disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws (instead of automatically failing) and creatures attack you without advantage

name: Advanced Weapon Holsters
mechanic: Your Carry Capacity is equal to your Strength + Your level

name: Advanced Weapon Proficiency
mechanic: Choose a ranged weapon (Shotgus, SMGs, Pistols, Assault Rifles, or Sniper Rifles). You now have +4 proficiency with that weapon.

name: Ambush
mechanic: When you use a Tech Power from Tactical Cloak, each creature that would make a saving throw makes the saving throw at a disadvantage.

name: Special Ammo
mechanic:
Select special ammo type. 
-- Use: Equipping specialed ammo clip can be done before combat. During combat it takes 1 action. If playing with the Thermal Clip rules, you must decide how many clips of the special ammo you bring and it lasts until you're out of clip. Otherwise the power lasts indefinately. 
-- Types
{!table}Name - Effect
-- Armor-Piercing - You ranged weapon deals piercing damaage. While this ammo power is equipped, ranged attacks made with this weapon ignore 2AC (+2 bonus).
-- Cryo - You ranged weapon deals cold damage. Ranged attacks made which Cryo Ammo equiped have a chance to Freeze the target. Unprotected creatures must make a Strength saving throw (DC 10). On a failed save, a creature is Frozen for 1 round.
-- Disruptor - Plus 4 damage to shields
-- Incindiary - Succesful ranged attacks with the weapon have a chance to set the target ablaze. The target it makes a Constitutuion saving throw (DC 10). On a failed save, they take an additional 1d4 damage.
-- Shredder - Plus 3 damage to unshielded enemies.
-- Warp - Warp bullets strip away additional barrier ticks. A sucessful ranged attack on a target with an active Barrier will strip away 2 Barrier ticks. Warp ammo can detonate primed targets.
{/table}

name: Annihilation Field
mechanic: Spin a field of corrupted, biotic energy that extends out from your in a 5m radius and moves with you, remainng centered on you and reducing your movement speed by half. -- Each creature within the sphere makes a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the field's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
adv-option-1: AntiArmor - Each creature that fails the saving throw takes a -1 penalty to their AC.
adv-option-2: Detonate - You may use your action to shatter the field into powerful projectiles. Choose up to 4 creatures you can see within 20m. Each creature must pass a Dexterity saving throw, or take 1d10 damage. These projectiles can detonate other powers. -- When you cast this spell at the 5th level, increase the number of creatures you can target by 1.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4

name: Arc Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to create an Arc Genade. Target an area within 10m. Each creature within 3m of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 13). A creature takes a creature takes 3d6 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successfule one. Arc Grenade deals double damage to shields.

name: Balistic Blades
mechanic: You eject your omni-tool attack towards a creature or object within 10m. Make a ranged spell attack (using Strength modifier). On a success, roll your AD and deal Xd6 piercing damage, where X is your roll. On a failed attack, you do not use an AD, but you cannot use another Adrenaline Rush this turn.

name: Barrier
mechanic: Tap into your biotic ability and restore all of your Barrier Ticks.
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

name: Barrier Detonation
mechanic: You detonate a portion of your Barrier (3 ticks) to lift and dangle nearby targets. Larged-sized or less targets within 2m must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become restrained (lifted)
adv-option-1: Improved Lift - Affects hugh-sized or lower creatures
adv-option-2: Radius - Increase the size of the detonation to 5m
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1 when you reach 5th level (2), 11th level (3), and 17th level (4).

name: Barrier Wealth
mechanic: Increase Barrier Capacity to 6

name: Battlemaster
mechanic:
{!level} When you cast cantrips, you can choose either advancement option
-- When you cast lvl 1 spells, you can choose either advancement option
-- When you cast lvl 2 spells, you can choose either advancement option

name: Biotic Focus
mechanic: Focus your biotic energies into your muscles granting additional speed and strength. Your speed and melee damage are doubled and you have advantage on Strength saving throws. You can use Biotic Focus as one of your attacks for the Extra Attack ability.
adv-option-1: Conductor - When you hit a target with a melee attack, restore 1d6 shield points.
adv-option-2: Vampire - When you hit a target with a melee attack, restore 1d6 hit points.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5 level or higher, the damage increases by 1 for each slot level above 4

name: Biotic Orbs
mechanic: Generate 3 biotic orbs around you. If you have at least 3 orbs, you gain an additional max level (highest available level) spell slot. To use an orb, make a ranged attack on a creature within 20m. On a hit, deal force damage equal to 2d6 + your biotic modifier.
adv-option-1: Improved Orbs - Gain 2 max level spell slots when 3 orbs are active
adv-option-2: Defense Orbs - You can use your orbs as a reaction to create a micro barrier on the incoming attack, reducing the damage as a normal barrier tick would. You can use this power on yourself or other creatures.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2

name: Biotic Powers
mechanic: Learn or advance your biotic powers. The first number indicates the number of new spells you can learn or advance. For example 2(3): you can either learn 2 new spells, advance 2 spells, or learn a spell and advance a spell. The second number indicates the max level of the spell you can learn or advance. In this example, you can learn or advance spells of level 3 or less, including cantrips. Though you can learn new catrips this way, you cannot know more cantrips than allowed by your level (indicated on you class sheet).

name: Biotic Slash
mechanic: Manifest your biotics into a swirl of blades. Each hostile creature must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
adv-option-1: Shock - Electrify the blades, changing the damage type to lightening (double damage to shields).
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die to d8
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2

name: Biotic Sphere
mechanic: Use your biotics to channel as sphere that extends out from your in a 5m radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you. While the sphere is active, you cannot use other biotic abilities. -- The sphere has hit points equals to 5d20 + your biotic modifier. -- Hostile creatures cannot enter or leave the sphere. So, yes, it can be used like a wrecking ball. -- The sphere has 2 effects: -- Hostile attacks made on friendly targets are absorbed by the sphere. If the attack calls for a saving throw, the sphere automatically fails it. -- Friendly attacks on hostile creatures within the sphere have advantage. -- The sphere dissipates when it's hit points are gone. If an attack would deal more damage than the remaining hit points of the sphere, the sphere soaks all of the damage. For example, if the sphere has 2 hit points and is hit for 8 damage. All 8 damage points are soaked and the sphere dissipates.
adv-option-1: Infuse Ammo - Friendly creatures inside the sphere add 1d4 for damage to all ranged weapon attacks on creatures outside of the sphere. This damage can detonate abilities. Subtract the additional damage from the sphere's health.
adv-option-2: Armored - The sphere has resistance to all damage.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d20 for each slot level above 5

name: Blade Armor
mechanic: A biotic spike protrudes from each of your shoulderguards (2 spikes total). When you are hit with a melee attack or when hit a creature with a melee attack, you can use spike to deal 2d4 piercing damage to the creature.
adv-option-1: Poisoned - Transform the damage type to poison. A creature hit by your blade must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save it is poisoned.
adv-option-2: Explosive - Transform the damage type to bludgeoning. A creature hit by your blade must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save it is stunned.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 2

name: Cain Trip Mine
mechanic: Spend 2 TP to launch a Cain Trip Mine. The mine affixes to a solid surface and projects a beam tripwire. When the mine explodes, creatures within 3m take 2d12 fire damage. -- This tech can be used like a grenade: Each creature within 3m must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 13). A creature takes 2d12 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. -- Creatures need to pass a Perception check to notice the mine. -- Creatures need to pass a Hacking check to disarm it. -- A successful ranged attack on the mine (DC 10) will cause it to detonate, see above for resolution.
higher-level: You can spend up to 2 TP.

name: Carnage
mechanic: A biotic blast originates outward in a cone up to 5m away. Each creature caught in the blast must make Constitution saving throw. A creature takes force damage equal to 1d10 + your biotic modifier on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
adv-option-1: Anti-Flesh - Carnage deals double damage to unprotected, organic targets.
adv-option-2: AntiArmor - Each creature that fails the saving throw takes a -1 penalty to their AC.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1

name: Charge
mechanic: Make a ranged spell attack on a target creature or object you can see within 20m. On a success, teleport and slam into the target. If target is an object, send it flying. The first creature within the object's trajectory must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 damage. If the target is a creature, it is knocked prone and takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage. You gain 2 Barrier Ticks.
adv-option-1: Improved Regeneration - Regain 4 Barrier Ticks
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d8
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

name: Cluster Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target an area within 10m. Each creature within 3m of the target must make two consecurtive Dexterity saving throws (DC 13). A creature takes 3d6 thunder damage on 2 failed saves, or half as much damage on a failed save and a successful one.

name: Concussive Shot
mechanic: You use the additional time provided by your adrenaline rush to swap in a specialzed thermal clip. Roll your AD. When you hit with a ranged attack, the target is knocked prone must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus with the weapon + your AD Roll). On a failed save, the target is stunned for 1 round. The clip remains in your weapon until you reload.

name: Cryo Blast
mechanic: Spend X TP and choose a target within 20m. If the target is unprotected, it makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save the target is Frozen for 1 turn. On a success or if the target is protected, it's movement speed is halved. Any creatures within Xx2m have their movement speed halved.
adv-option-1: Focused Blast - You focus the blast on the target, sacrificing the AOE slowing effect. But your blast now deals Xd6 cold damage.
adv-option-2: Improved Freeze - The target remains frozen for 3 turns.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Cunning Action
mechanic: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or activate Tactical Cloak.

name: Dark Channel
mechanic: Make a ranged attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, you shoot a bold of biotic energy and the creature takes 1d4 psychic damage. The creature continues to take 1d4 damage on your turn while you maintain the spell. If the creature dies, Dark Channel transfers to another random, hostile creature within 10m. Only one Dark Channel can may be active at a time.
adv-option-1: Improved Duration - Dark Channel lasts 8 turns.
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d8
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

name: Dark Sphere
mechanic: Launch a slow-moving, 3m sphere of dark energy in a straight line infront of you. It moves 5m each turn, at the start of your turn, until it reaches 20m. Each creatures caught in the path must make a Dexterity saving throw, but has advantage due to the speed of the sphere. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d8 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one. When the sphere reaches 20m, it detonates and each creature within 3m must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 1d8 damage or half as much damage on a successful one. You can use a second action to detonate the sphere early
adv-option-1: Gravity Well - As the sphere moves forward, it draws creatures in. Dexterity saving throws are no longer made at an advantage.
adv-option-2: Amplify - Every 5m, the sphere's potential damage increases. Add 1d8 to the detonation damage for each 5m the sphere travels.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5

name: Decoy
mechanic: Spend X TP to summon a holographic copy of yourself at a location within 10m. The copy mimics your actions. When a creature attacks, it can make an Intelligence (Perception) check and, if it succeeds, is not fooled. The DC of the check is 8 + your Tech modifier + X.
adv-option-1: Explosive - As an action, you can spend X TP detonate your Decoy. Each creature within 3m must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Xd6 fire damage or half as much on a successful one.
adv-option-2: Improved Decoy - Your Decoy becomes so life-like that creatures have disadvanage on the Intelligence (Perception) check.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Defense Matrix
mechanic: Spend X TP to reinforce your armor with special foccault currents. You gain resistance to your choice of X damage types.
adv-option-1: Shield - Deploy the matrix as a stationary shield. Up to 2 creatures of normal size can stand behind the shield, gaining the resistance benefit when attacked by creatures standing on the other side of the shield.
adv-option-2: Improved Defense - Gain a +3 bonus to your AC.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Defensive Pylon
mechanic: Each time Supply Pylon takes damage, it casts a 1 TP Overload at it's attacker. DC on this attack is 10.

name: Devastator Mode
mechanic: Roll your AD and root yourself in place for X turns, where X is your AD roll + your Constitution modifier. As a bonus action your may swap your weapon when you activate Devastator Mode. -- While Devastator Mode is active, your speed is reduced to 0, you automatically fail any Dexterity saving throws, and you cannot use any other abilities. You can only make ranged weapon attacks with your equipped weapon. -- However, you instantly restore all of your Shield Points, heat has no effect on your weapon (i.e., you do not have to reload), and you can make 2 ranged weapon attacks per turn. -- You can spend an additional action to end Devastator Mode early.
adv-option-1: Improved Damage - While in Devastator Mode, add your weapon's proficiency bonus as damage to each successful ranged attack.
adv-option-2: Tactician - You have advantage when making your AD roll for Devastator Mode, but you can choose either roll.

name: Dominate
mechanic: Choose an organic creature within 20m. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving thow or it becomes Domintated. A dominated creature is considered charmed and can't use spells or abilities. -- On it's turn, the dominated creature attacks the closest hostile creature, making ranged weapon attack or melee attack it does not have a weapon. If it doesn't have a weapon and there are no hostile creatures within melee range, the dominated creature uses its turn to run towards the closest hostile creature. --  Each time the dominated creature takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.
adv-option-1: Total Control - You take the the dominated creatures action. You may use it's spells and abilities.
adv-option-2: Damage - While the creature is dominated, it takes 2d6 psychic damage at the end of it's turn. This damage does not proc an opportunity to end Dominate.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6 level or higher, the damage increases by 1 for each slot level above 5

name: Drone
mechanic:
Spend X TP to summon a drone. Each drone type has a unique set of abilities. You can only have a single Drone active at a time unless otherwise stated.
{!table}Name - Health - Speed - Ability
-- Combat - Your lvl + Xd6 - 5m - On your turn, the drone makes a ranged weapon attack on a hostile creature you can see within 20m. On a hit, the Drone deals 1d8 piercing damage.
-- AntiSheild - Your lvl + Xd8 - 10m - On your turn, it moves to an enemy of your choosing and makes a melee attack. On a success, the target takes 1d6 shocking damage. Deals double damage to shields.
-- Defense - Your lvl + Xd10 - 5m - The drone hovers around a friendly creature of your choosing. When the creature takes damage, the drone soaks half of the damage done.
-- Kamakaze - Your lvl + Xd4 - 10m - The drone seeks out a hositle creature your can see and moves towards it. If the drone reaches the target without being destroyed, it deals Xd8 fire damage.
{/table}
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Drone Efficiency
mechanic: If you have no Drones active, the next Drone you summon costs 1d4 less TP. For example, you roll 3 on a d4 and choose to spend 1 TP on a Drone. You would calculate the drones health based on 4 TP spent. You cannot use this ability to spend more than 5 TP.

name: Drone Mastery
mechanic: You can summon 2 Drones in one action.

name: Drone Sidekick
mechanic: When you summon a Drone, role a die of your choice. On an odd roll, your Drone generates a Sidekick: a second 1 TP version of itself. The sidekick does not count towards your maximum number of Drones. When calculating the Sidekick's health, use 1/2 your level, rounded up.

name: Drone Swarm
mechanic: You can have 3 Drones active at once.

name: Dual Drones
mechanic: Your can have 2 Drones active at once.

name: Eagle Eye
mechanic: +2 bonus to ranged attacks

name: Efficient Bang
mechanic: Grenade Tech only costs you 2 TP

name: Efficient Cloak
mechanic: Tactical Cloak does not consume tech points, at the cost of your sneak attack die type being reduced to d4

name: Electric Slash
mechanic: Spend X TP to unleash a wave of electric energy in a 10m cone originating from you. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Xd6 lightening damage and is restrained for 1 turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't restrained.
adv-option-1: Shield Restore - Gain Shield Points equal to half of your damage roll.
adv-option-2: Stun - Creatures that fail the saving throw are stunned instead of restrained.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Elusive
mechanic: You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.

name: Energy Drain
mechanic: Spend X TP and make a ranged attack on a creature your can see within range. On a hit, the creature takes Xd8 necrotic damage. You gain Sheild Points equal to half your damage roll.
adv-option-1: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d12.
adv-option-2: Healing - You gain Hit Points equal to half of your damage roll, but decrease the damage die to d6.
higher-level: You can spend up to 3 TP.

name: Evasion
mechanic: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

name: Extra Attack
mechanic: You can attack twice when you choose to make a melee attack or ranged weapon attack as your action.

name: Eye for Detail
mechanic: You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action feature to make a Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a hidden creature or object, to make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to uncover and decipher clues, or to use Insightful Fighting.

name: Fighting Style
mechanic:
{!table} Style - Perk - Advanced Perk 
-- Brawler - add 3 damage to all melee attack damage - you have advantage when melee attacking
-- Dual Weild - You can weild 2 pistols or SMGs (or combination thereof). Your off-hand weapon always shoots with a disadvantage. You will automatically miss targets out of range. - Remove the disadvantage penalty to your off-hand weapon
-- Fast Fingers - When you Action surge, if you are weilding a shotgun, you can reload it as a free action. This does not take the place of your Action Surge action. - When you Action surge, if you are weilding a shotgun, you can reload AND fire in the order of your choosing. This does not take the place of your Action Surge action.
-- Sawed-off - You successful shotgun attacks hit 1 additional creature within 2m of the original target. The additional creature takes 1/2 damage. - You hit 2 additional creatures.
-- Defense - +2AC and +10 Shields - +4AC and +20 Shields
-- Protection - When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5m of you, you can use your reaction to channel your barrier in front of the target and impose disadvantage on the attack roll. Costs a Barrier tick. - If the attack succeeds, the Barrier tick absorbs damage as a normal barrier tick would. If the attack fails, your barrier tick is refunded.
{/table}

name: First Aid
mechanic: Spend X TP to heal a friendly creature within reach. The creature gains Hit Points equal to Xd6 + your Tech modifier
adv-option-1: Adaptive - The healed creature gains resistance to the last damage type it suffered. This effect lasts for 1 minute.
adv-option-2: Improved Healing - Increase the healing die type to d8
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Flamethrower
mechanic: Spend X TP to eject flames in a 3m cone, originating from you. Each creature within the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes Xd8 damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
adv-option-1: AntiArmor - Each creature that fails the saving throw looses take as -1 penalty to their AC.
adv-option-2: Exhaust - The flames leave behind a thick smoke for 1 turn. Hostile enemies have disadvantage while makeing ranged weapon attacks against you until the start of your next turn.

name: Flare
mechanic: Choose up to 3 creatures that you can see within range. Focus your biotics into rays of light that seek out the targets and explode. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded and takes radiant damage equal to 4d12 + your biotic modifier, or half as much damage on a successful one.
adv-option-1: Improved Blind - Each creature is blinded no matter the result of it's saving throw.
adv-option-2: Multiflare - You may target up to 6 creatures, but if you target more that 3, decrease the damage to a d6.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 4

name: Flashbang Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target an area within 10m. Each creature within 3m of the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 13). On a failed save, a creature is blinded for 1 turn.

name: Fortification
mechanic: Spend X TP to increase your AC by that amount.
adv-option-1: Explosive - You can spend 1 action to denotate this power. Each creature within a 5m radius of you looses 1 AC.
adv-option-2: Improved Armor - Your AC gain equals your TP spend +2
higher-level: You can spend up to 3 TP.

name: Frag Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target an area within 10m. Each creature within 3m of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 13). On a failed save, a creature takes 3d12 piercing damage or half as much damage on a successful one.
class-list: Adept, Engineer, Infiltrator, Sentinel, Soldier, Vanguard

name: Havok Strike
mechanic: Use the propulsion jet to spring to a location within 5m. When you land, roll your AD and your melee attack damage. Each creature within a 3m radius of the impact point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes X times the damage of you melee attack as slashing damage, where X is your AD roll. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
adv-option-1: Improved Distance - You can jump 10m.
adv-option-2: Improved Radius - Increase the radius of the impact to 5m

name: Hawk Missile Launcher
mechanic: Role your AD and activate your personal shoulder cannon: the Hawk Missile Launcher. The cannon makes a ranged weapon attack on an object or creature you can see within range. This attack automatically hits and the target takes Xd12 thunder damage where X is your AD roll.
adv-option-1: AntiShield - The missle detonates a small EMP, transforming the damage to lightening (double damage to shields).
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Your AD roll cannot be less than 3.

name: Healing Bolts
mechanic: Release a healing blast of biotic energy. Target up to six organic creatures you can see within range. Each creature regains HP equal to  4d6 + your biotc modifier.
adv-option-1: Adrenaline - Healed creatures have advantage on their next saving throw.
adv-option-2: Improved Healing - Increase the healing die type to d8.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4

name: Healing Surge
mechanic: Consume any number of your barrier ticks and choose and organic creature within range. The creature regains HP equal to Xd4 + your biotic modifier, where X is the number of barrier ticks used to cast this ability.
adv-option-1: Resistance - Target has resistance to all damage the next time it is attacked.
adv-option-2: Area-of-Effect - Friendly creatures within 3m of the target are healed for half the amount.
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

name: Healing Touch
mechanic: Choose an organic creature within melee range. The target regains HP equal to 1d8 + your biotic modifier.
adv-option-1: Focused - The healed creature has advantage on it's next attack.
adv-option-2: Improved healing - Increase the healing die type to d12.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1

name: Heavy Weapon Hack
mechanic: When your heavy weapon runs out of ammo, you can jerry-rig an additional use for 5 TP.

name: Hex Shield
mechanic: Eject a 5m hexgon shapped sheild onto the ground in front of you. You can fire through it, but incoming attacks are soaked by the shield's HP. Roll your AD. The shield's HP is equal to X times your level, where X is your AD roll.

name: Homing Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target a creature you can see within range. The target creature takes 1d6 thunder damage. Each other creature within 3m of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

name: Hunter Mode
mechanic: Spend 3 TP to channel shields into auxillary combat systems. Lose 3d6 shields but gain the following: -- Increase movement by 5m. -- +2 to ranged attack rolls. -- No disadvantage on attacking targets behind partial cover. -- Add 1d6 piercing damage to melee attack roles.
adv-option-1: Tech Mode - Increase the damage of all Tech powers by 1 die type (max d20)
adv-option-2: Biotic Hunter - You have resistance to all damage caused by biotic spells and advantage on saving throws caused by biotic spells.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Imbue Omni-tool
mechanic: Spend X TP to imbue your omni-tool with fire, cold, or lightending properties. For the duration, or until you cast this spell again, you have a +X bonus to melee attack rolls and your attacks deal an additional Xd4 damage of the type you select. X equals the number of TP spent.
higher-level: You can spend up to 3 TP.

name: Improved Barrier
mechanic:
{!level} Damage reduction of a Barrier tick is increased to d8
-- Damage reduction of a Barrier tick is increased to d12

name: Improved Barrier Capacity
mechanic:
{!level} Increase your maximum Barrier Ticks by 3
-- Increase your maximum Barrier Ticks by 6

name: Healing Drone
mechanic: You learn to summon a Healing drone: -- Health: your lvl + Xd8 -- Speed: 10m -- Ability: The drone seeks out a friendly creature of your choice. If it is within melee range it casts a 1 TP First Aid on the target.
adv-option-1: Adaptive - When you cast Healing Drone, you choose either advancement option of First Aid.
adv-option-2: Dual Drones - You summon 2 Healing drones, but each drone has 1/2 health.

name: Improved Shields
mechanic: +10 Shields

name: Incinerate
mechanic: Spend X TP and make a ranged tech attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the target takes Xd10 fire damage.
adv-option-1: Frozen Combo - Deal double damage to frozen targets.
adv-option-2: Radial Blast - On a miss, the target creature takes half the damage.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Indominable
mechanic:
{!level} You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
-- You can use Indominable twice before a long rest.

name: Inferno Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target an area within 10m. Each creature within 3m of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d4 damage or half as much on a successful one. The 3m area continues to burn for 1 minute.  A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the burning space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

name: Infiltration
mechanic: You can unfailingly create false identities for yourself. You can't establish an identity that belongs to someone else. For example, you might establish yourself within mercernary gang to gain access to their supplies or armory, or a rich colonist to gain access to a fancy party. Thereafter, if you adopt the new identity as a disguise, other creatures believe you to be that person until given an obvious reason not to. If you do not have the appropriate time to research an identity, you will at least gain advantage on pursuation rolls.

name: Insightful Fighting
mechanic: You gain the ability to decipher an opponent's tactics and develop a counter to them. As an action (or as a bonus action using Eye for Detail), you make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn't incapacitated, opposed by the target's Charisma (Deception) check. If you succeed, you can add your Sneak Attach damage to your next successfull melee or ranged attack without having to come out of Tactical Cloak. This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until you successfully use Insightful Fighting against a different target.

name: Invention
mechanic: At the 20th level, you create an Invention. The invention should be condoned by the DM to not be overpowered. But should give you, your party, your drones, etc an advantage.

name: Invasion
mechanic: Spend 1 TP per creature size and choose a synthetic within 20m (e.g. 1 TP for small, 2TP for medium, 3TP for large, etc). The synthetic must succeed on an Intelligence saving thow or becomes hacked. A hacked synthetic won't attack friendly creatures and can't use spells or abilities. -- On it's turn, hacked synthetic attacks the closest hostile creature, making ranged weapon attack or melee attack it does not have a weapon. If it doesn't have a weapon and there are no hostile creatures within melee range, the hacked synthetic uses its turn to run towards the closest hostile creature. --  Each time the synthetic takes damage, it makes a new Intelligence saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.
adv-option-1: Total Control - You take the the hacked synthetic's action. You may use it's spells and abilities.
adv-option-2: Damage - While the synthetic is hacked, it takes 2d6 shock damage at the end of it's turn. This damage does not proc an opportunity to end Invasion.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Lash
mechanic: Consume barrier ticks to create a whip of biotic energy. Each barrier tick consumed increases the range of the whip by 2m. Target a creature you can see within the resulting range. The target takes 2d10 slashing damage and becomes grappled. If the creature tries to escape the grapple, the contested roll is agaisnt your Constitution.
adv-option-1: Improved Grapple - The grappled creature has disadvantage when trying to escape.
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d12.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2

name: Lift Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target an area within 10m. Each creature within 3m of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is restrained (lifted) for 1 turn.

name: Lots'a Bang
mechanic: Choose 2 grenade powers. Soldiers have a Grenade column which indicates the number of times they can use a grenade power per long rest (much like a spell slot). This increases with level.

name: Makeshift Grenades
mechanic: Grenade Tech only costs you 1 TP.

name: Marksman
mechanic: Roll your AD and subtract the number from 20. If you make a ranged gun attack this turn, anything above the result is considered a critical hit. For example: you roll a 3; on this turn a natural 17, 18, 19, and 20 are critical hits.

name: Master Duelist
mechanic: Your mastery of combat lets you turn failure to success in combat. If you miss with an attack roll, you can choose to roll it again with advantage. Once you do so, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Master Tactician
mechanic: You can use the Help action as a bonus action. Additionally, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than 5 feet of you, if the target can see or hear you.

name: Misdirection
mechanic: You can sometimes cause another creature to suffer an attack meant for you. When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover against that attack, you can use your reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.

name: Multi-frag Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target 3 areas within 10m. Each creature within 3m of eachtarget must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d4 piercing damage or half as much on a successful one.

name: Neural Shock
mechanic: Spend X TP and target an organic creature you can see within range. The creatue makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Xd6 psychic damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage bypasses shields.
adv-option-1: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d8.
adv-option-2: Paralyze - If a creature fails the saving throw, it is paralyzed for 1 turn.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Nightshade Blades
mechanic: Your Omni-tool is equipped with microscopic, poison-tipped blades that are able to piece through shields and armor. To use a blade, make a ranged weapon attack on an organic creature you can see within range, you add your proficiency bonus to this roll. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 poison damage and must make a successful Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. You must be within melee range and use an action to recover the blade. Or recover all 3 of your blades on a short rest.
adv-option-1: Paralyze - In addition to being poisoned, the creature is paralyzed until the start of your next turn.
adv-option-2: Improved Poison - The creature has disadvantage on it's Constitution saving throw.
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

name: Nova
mechanic: Consume all of your barrier ticks to send a massive biotic blast in a 5m radius originating from you. Each creature caught in the blast must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes for damage equal to Xd6 + your biotic modifier, where X is the number of barrier ticks consumer, on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
adv-option-1: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d10.
adv-option-2: Half Blast - You can choose to use half of your Barrier ticks to cast Nova twice in a single turn. You can move in between the blasts.
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

name: Overload
mechanic: Spend X TP and maked a ranged tech attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the creature takes Xd6 lightening damage. If the creature is synthetic, it is stunned for 1 turn.
adv-option-1: Chain Overload - On a hit, your overload jumps to a second target within 5m, dealing half of it's damage.
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d10
higher-level: You can spend up to 3 TP.

name: Overpowered
mechanic: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

name: Phase Disruptor
mechanic: Consume up to 3 barrier ticks make a ranged spell attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the creature takes 1d4 force damage per tick used. -- The spell potential tick use increases by 1 when you reach 5th level (4 ticks), 11th level (5 ticks), and 17th level (6 ticks).
adv-option-1: Improved Damage -- Increase the damage die type to d8
adv-option-2: Shield Negation - The damage passes through shields.
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

name: Poison Strike
mechanic: Choose a target location within 10m. You encase yourself in a biotic barrier and slash through and creatures and objects in between you and the target location. Each creature within 2m of the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 poison damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.While you perform this maneuver, hostile creatures cannot make opportunity attacks on you.
adv-option-1: Paralyze - Organic creatures that fail their Dexterity saving throw also must succeeed on a Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 turn.
adv-option-2: Double Dash - You can break up your dash into two 5m dashes, changing direction between dashes.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1

name: Potent Biotics
mechanic: If a creature succeeds a saving throw against your damaging cantrip, or you fail an attack role, the target still takes half damage.

name: Proficient Biotic
mechanic: Additional max level spell slot. Gain 2 barrier ticks.

name: Proximity Mine
mechanic: Spend 1 TP to lay a proximity mine. A creature that comes within 2m of the mine makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes 1 thunder damage, or half as much damage on successful one.

name: Pull
mechanic: Choose a large-size or smaller creature or object, other than yourself, that you can see within range. Yank the creature into the air where it dangles helplessly, becoming restrained. While you maintain Pull, you can use a reaction or bonus action to move or throw the target. The speed of this movement is determined by the targets size: Small = 10m, Medium = 5m, Large = 2m.
adv-option-1: Force - You use pull to move huge-sized objects a short distance (up to 2m). This might result in knocking the target off balance or creating a natural barrier.
adv-option-2: Multi-pull - When you cast Pull, you can choose 2 targets. If you choose more than 1, neither target can be larger than a medium size.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2 level or higher, the damage increases by 1- for each slot level above 1

name: Pure Biotics
mechanic: Add your proficiency bonus to all biotic damage.

name: Quick Biotic
mechanic: Targets that would make a saving throw against one of your biotic abilities makes that saving throw at a disadvantage

name: Quick Reload
mechanic: When you activate Adrenaline Rush, you can choose to reload your current weapon as a free action

name: Quick Swap
mechanic: When you activate Adrenaline Rush, you can swap your weapon as a free action

name: Reave
mechanic: Target a creature you can see within range. The target takes a -2 penalty to their AC and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2 necrotic damage or half as much on a successful one.
adv-option-1: AntiArmor - The target takes a -5 penalty to their AC.
adv-option-2: Vampiric - Regain HP equal to half of the damage done.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3 level or higher, the damage increases by 1 for each slot level above 2

name: Recon Mine
mechanic: Spend 2 TP to launch a recon mine to a location of your choice within 20m. It first sticks to the target location then scans enemies within a 10m cone. After your turn ends, any enemy that walks through the scanning cone loses 1 AC. You may spend another action to detonate the mine, dealing 2d4 thunder damage to each creature within 2m. -- Creatures need to pass a Perception check to notice the mine. -- Creatures need to pass a Hacking check to disarm it, failing the hack will cause it to explode. -- A successful ranged attack on the mine (DC 10) will cause it to detonate, see above for resolution.
adv-option-1: Improved Recon - Reduce AC by 2
adv-option-2: Double Mines - Launch 2 mines to 2 separate locations. The AC reduction does not stack for creatures that walk through both scanning cones.
higher-level: You can spend up to 1 TP.

name: Regenerative Pylon
mechanic: Allies within 5m of Supply Pylon have increased Sheild regen of 1 die type (to a maximum of d20)

name: Repair Matrix
mechanic: As a reaction, you spend 5 TP to activate a powerful Foucault current. If you are knocked down, you immediately return to your feet. You gain the following benefits: -- Sheild Regeneration increases by 1 die type -- Speed increases by 5m. -- Regain 1[d6] HP at the start of your turn.
adv-option-1: Healing Matrix - Regain 2d8 instead of 1d6 at the start of your turn.
adv-option-2: Resisting Matrix - Your shields have resistance to shock damage. -- You cannot be frozen. -- Damage to your HP has resistance to fire damage.

name: Sabotage
mechanic: Spend 1 TP and make a ranged tech attack on a weapon you can see within 20m (DC 10). On a hit, the next time the weapon fires, it does half of it's damage to the creature firing the weapon.
adv-option-1: Multi-Weapon - You can target 3 weapons at once.
adv-option-2: Disable - After the weapon fires, it becomes jammed. It cannot be fired again until it is reloaded.

name: Sentry Turret
mechanic: Spend X TP to set up a sentry turrent within melee range. The turret has Xd8 health. At the end of your turn, the turret attacks. It continues to attack at the end of your turn until it is destroyed. -- If an hostile creature is within 5m, the turret shoots flames in a 5m cone in a direction of your choosing. Each creature within the 5m cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 fire damage or half as much damage on a successful one. -- If all hostile creatures are further than 5m of the turret, you choose a target within 20m. The turremt makes a ranged weapon attack on the target, proficiency +2. On a success, it deals 2d8 piercing damage.
adv-option-1: Power Turrent - Increase the damage die for the flame and ranged attack to a d12.
adv-option-2: Lasting Turret - Increase the die rolled for the turret's health to d12.

name: Shadow Broker
mechanic: You are an operative of the Shadow Broker and your focus is on people and on the influence and secrets they have. Many spies, courtiers, and schemers follow this archetype, leading lives of intrigue. Words are your weapons as often as guns or powers, and secrets and favors are some of your favorite treasures. This information may give you detailed information about a scheme or plot, call in favors, blackmail other characters. Tactically, it might give you access to security cameras, preventing surprise attacks or giving you access to security profiles and learning about enemies you might fight.

name: Shadow Strike
mechanic: Spend 5 TP to teleport to a target within 10m and make a melee attack. You have advantage on this attack. If successful, deal your melee damage plus your sneak attack damage to the target. At the end of the attack, activate Tactical Cloak and teleport to another location up 10m away. The teleportation can be used to free you from movement imparing effects such as grapple, restrained, etc.
adv-option-1: Rapid Strike - You may make 2 melee attacks, both with advantage, but only the first has your sneak attack damage applied.
adv-option-2: Stunning Strike - Targets hit with Shadow Strike are stunned for 1 turn

name: Shield Boost
mechanic: Spend X TP and recover Xd6 shields. You cannot go above your maximum shields.
adv-option-1: Friendly Boost - You can cast sheild boost on a friendly target within melee range.
adv-option-2: Overloading Boost - Creatures within melee range take 1d4 shock damage.
higher-level: You can spend up to 3 TP.

name: Shockwave
mechanic: Create a cascading shockwave in a 10m cylander originating from you. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d8 thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked down.
adv-option-1: Improved Distance - The shockwave travels 10m
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increase damage die type to d12
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2 level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1

name: Siege Pulse
mechanic: Roll your AD and store that many charges in your omni-tool. You can use an action to create a siege pulse in a 3m radius originating from you. Each creature within the radius must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are incapacitated for 1 turn.

name: Signature Spells
mechanic: Select 2 lvl2 or less spells. These spells can be cast at lvl 3 without using lvl3 spell slot.

name: Singularity
mechanic: Create a 5m sphere of dark energy at a target location within range. Each hostile creature within the sphere's radius must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be restrained (lifted). Only creatures of a large size or less are effected. Any hostile creature that comes within 2m of the sphere must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Agility) check or they are drawn into the sphere and become restratined (lifted).
adv-option-1: Heal - A friendly creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there is healed for 1d4.
adv-option-2: Damage - A hostile creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there is takes 1d4 necrotic damage.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2 level or higher, the damage increases by 1 for each slot level above 1

name: Slam
mechanic: Slam a lifted target onto the ground dealing damage equal to 1d8 + double your biotic modifier.
adv-option-1: Stun - The creature is stunned for 1 round.
adv-option-2: Impoved Damage - Increase the damage die type to d12
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

name: Snap Freeze
mechanic: Spend X TP to send a cryotic blast in an 3m cone, originating from you. Each creature within the blast makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature a frozen. On a successful save, a creature's movement speed is halved for 1 turn. -- Increase the DC of the saving throw by 1 for each 2 TP spent.
adv-option-1: AntiArmor - Creatues hit with Snap Freeze lose 1 AC per 2 TP spent.
adv-option-2: Improved Freeze - The DC increase is a 1:1 ratio.
higher-level: You can spend up to 10 TP.

name: Stasis
mechanic: Choose a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a contested Strength saving throw against your biotic modifier. On a failed save, the creature is restrained. Creatures of huge size or larger have advantage on the saving throw. At the beginning of the creature's turn, it can use it's action to make the saving throw again.
adv-option-1: Trap - Stasis can be cast on a location. If a creature enters the location, you cast Statis on it as a reaction. If automatically fails it's first saving throw.
adv-option-2: Weaken - A creature in Stasis takes a -3 penalty to AC.
higher-level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3 level or higher, the damage increases by 1 for each slot level above 2

name: Sticky Grenade
mechanic: Spend 3 TP or use a 3rd lvl spell slot to target an area within 10m. Creatures within 3m of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d6 thunder damage or half as much damage on a successful one. -- Instead, you may choose to make a ranged weapon attack on a target within 10m. You do not add any proficiency bonus to this role. You have advantage if the target is within melee range. On a hit, the target automatically fails it's Dexterity saving throw. -- Infiltrators using this power from Tactical Cloak can select a target within melee range and place the sticky grenade on the target instead of making the ranged attack (throwing the grenade). But the player will need to leave the 3m blast area or make a Dexterity saving throw like all other creatures within 3m.

name: Stimulant Pack
mechanic: Spend 2 TP to give yourself advantage on the next dexterity, strength, or constitution saving throw.
adv-option-1: Friendly - You can inject a creature within melee range with the stimulant pack
adv-option-2: Improved Attack - You can choose to apply the advantage to your next damage roll

name: Stroke of Luck
mechanic: At 20th level, you have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need to. If your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Submission Net
mechanic: Spend 2 TP to shoot a swarm of miniatuer pylons to a target location within 20m. The pylons form a 3m, electrified net originating from the chosen location. Creatures within the net cannot cast tech. -- To escape, a creature must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) check or must remain trapped in the net. If a creature does break free, it takes 1d6 lightening damage. -- If you have a submission net deployed, you can spend X TP to send electric currents through it. Each creature within the net makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Xd6 lightening damage, or half as much on a success.
adv-option-1: Shock - You can electrify the net as a bonus action the first time you cast Submission net.
adv-option-2: Improved Grip - Increase the DC to break free of the net by 3.
higher-level: You can spend up to 5 TP.

name: Supply Pylon
mechanic: Spend X TP to summon a Supply Pylon to a location within 5m. The Supply Pylon has hit points equal to Xd6 + your level, AC 12, and 1 charge of 4 different supplies. Party members (including you) can spend 1 action accessing the supply pylon (must be within melee range) to gain 1 of the 4 supplies: - Replenish Heavy Weapon Ammo - Replenish 5 TP or 5 levels worth of Spell slots - Heal themselves for 3d6 - Restore 3d6 Shields. Only 1 benefit of each type can be claimed, but at higher levels Supply Pylon has more charges of each supply. If the Pylon is destroyed before the charges are used, they disappear. -- The Supply pylon's die type and charges increase with level: At lvl 5 = d8, 2 charges. At lvl 11 = d10, 3 charges. At lvl 17 = d20, 4 charges.

name: Tactical Cloak
mechanic: Use 1 Tech point to become Invisible. You continue to make noise, but you have advantage on stealth checks. In combat, when you make a melee attack, ranged attack, or use a power, your tacktical cloak ends. Most powers give you some advantage when you use them from Tactical Cloak. When you make a successful melee or ranged attack from Tactical Cloak, add your Sneak Attack damage.

name: Tactical Scan
mechanic: Use 1 Tech point to scan a creature within 20m. You relay the data to your team member's Omni-tool. This improves the natural crit chance on ranged attacks by 1. I.e., usually a 19 & 20 are now natural crits, but this ability can stack with other crit improving powers.
adv-option-1: Area Scan - Scan a 5m area. All creatures are affected.
adv-option-2: Improved Scan - You can now spend up to 3 TP, improving natural crit chance by that amount.

name: Tech Armor
mechanic: Spend 3 TP to activate your Tech Armor. Increase your max Shield Points (SP) by 10 and immediately gain 10 SP. You have a +3 bonus to your AC and resistance to all damage done to your HP. While Tech Armor is active your speed is reduced by half and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. As a reaction, you can deactivate Tech Armor, when you do, gain another 10 SP.

name: Tech Power
mechanic: Learn or advance a tech power.

name: Teleporting Dodge
mechanic: You can use 3 Barrier ticks to automatically pass a Dexterity saving throw.

name: Throw
mechanic: Make a ranged spell attack on a target you can see within range. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d6 + your biotic modifier and is knocked prone.
adv-option-1: Area-of-Effect - Any creature within 3m of the target takes half of the damage.
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increas the damage die type to d8
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

name: Uncanny Dodge
mechanic: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

name: Warp
mechanic: Rip your enemy apart at a molecular level. Make a ranged spell attack on an organic creature you can see within range. On a hit, target takes necrotic damage equal to 1d4 + you biotic modifier. This damage bypasses shields.
adv-option-1: AntiArmor - The creature takes a -1 penalty to it's AC.
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increas the damge die type to d6
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

name: Lance
mechanic: Make a ranged spell attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the creature takes damage equal to 1d8 + your biotic modifier.
adv-option-1: Anit-Shield - Damage type become lightening (double damage to shields)
adv-option-2: Improved Damage - Increas the damge die type to d10
higher-level: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
